message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about applying deep neural networks to ad-hoc retrieval, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses text matching tasks, which are related to natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL), making cs.CL the second most likely sub-category. The paper uses convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which are a popular tool in machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL), making cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper deals with text data, which is often processed using computer vision (CV) techniques, making cs.CV a possible sub-category.
